goals.question: What is the trend of CO2 concentration over time?
goals.visualization: Line chart of CO2 concentration over time
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify if there is an overall increase or decrease in CO2 concentration over time.

goals.question: What is the average CO2 concentration per year?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of average CO2 concentration per year
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify the average CO2 concentration per year and if there are any significant changes over time.

goals.question: What is the distribution of CO2 concentration?
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify the range and frequency of CO2 concentration values in the dataset.

goals.question: What is the relationship between CO2 concentration and temperature?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of CO2 concentration and temperature
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify if there is a correlation between CO2 concentration and temperature.

goals.question: What is the seasonal variation in CO2 concentration?
goals.visualization: Line chart of CO2 concentration over time with seasonal trend lines
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify if there is a seasonal pattern in CO2 concentration and if it varies over time.

code:
```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_csv('co2-concentration.csv')

# Convert date fields to date types
data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], format='%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S', errors='coerce')

# Drop rows with NaT values
data = data[pd.notna(data['date'])]

# Line chart of CO2 concentration over time
sns.set_style("darkgrid")
sns.lineplot(x="date", y="co2", data=data, color='blue')

# Set chart title
plt.title("What is the trend of CO2 concentration over time?", wrap=True)

# Rotate x-axis labels for legibility
plt.xticks(rotation=45)

# Show plot
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Year'] = pd.DatetimeIndex(data['Date']).year
    data = data.groupby('Year').mean().reset_index()
    ax = sns.barplot(x='Year', y='CO2 Concentration (ppm)', data=data, color='blue')
    ax.axhline(y=data['CO2 Concentration (ppm)'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='--', label='Average CO2 Concentration')
    ax.set(xlabel='Year', ylabel='CO2 Concentration (ppm)')
    ax.legend()
    plt.xticks(rotation=45, ha='right')
    plt.tight_layout()
    return plt

chart = plot(data)
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_csv('co2-concentration.csv')

# Plot histogram
sns.histplot(data=data, x='CO2 Concentration', kde=True, color='blue')
plt.axvline(data['CO2 Concentration'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Mean')
plt.axvline(data['CO2 Concentration'].median(), color='green', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Median')
plt.legend()
plt.title('What is the distribution of CO2 concentration?')
plt.xlabel('CO2 Concentration')
plt.ylabel('Frequency')

plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_csv('co2-concentration.csv')

# Convert date fields to date types
data['Date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Date'], format='%Y-%m-%d', errors='coerce')

# Drop rows with NaT values
data = data[pd.notna(data['Date'])]

# Create scatter plot
sns.scatterplot(x='CO2 concentration (ppm)', y='Temperature (deg F)', data=data)

# Set chart title
plt.title('What is the relationship between CO2 concentration and temperature?', wrap=True)

# Show plot
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_csv('co2-concentration.csv')

# Convert date field to datetime type
data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], format='%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S', errors='coerce')

# Drop rows with NaT values
data = data[pd.notna(data['date'])]

# Extract year and month from date
data['year'] = data['date'].dt.year
data['month'] = data['date'].dt.month

# Compute monthly average CO2 concentration
monthly_avg = data.groupby(['year', 'month'])['co2'].mean().reset_index()

# Plot line chart with seasonal trend lines
sns.set_style('whitegrid')
ax = sns.lineplot(x='date', y='co2', data=data, ci=None)
sns.lineplot(x='date', y='co2', data=data, ci=None, hue='year', legend=False, palette='viridis')
sns.lineplot(x='date', y='co2', data=data, ci=None, hue='month', legend=False, palette='viridis')
ax.set(xlabel='Year', ylabel='CO2 Concentration (ppm)')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.title('What is the seasonal variation in CO2 concentration?')
plt.legend(title='Year', loc='upper left', bbox_to_anchor=(1, 1))
plt.show()
```

chart.code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_csv('co2-concentration.csv')

# Convert date field to datetime type
data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], format='%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S', errors='coerce')

# Drop rows with NaT values
data = data[pd.notna(data['date'])]

# Extract year and month from date
data['year'] = data['date'].dt.year
data['month'] = data['date'].dt.month

# Compute monthly average CO2 concentration
monthly_avg = data.groupby(['year', 'month'])['co2'].mean().reset_index()

# Plot line chart with seasonal trend lines
sns.set_style('whitegrid')
ax = sns.lineplot(x='date', y='co2', data=data, ci=None)
sns.lineplot(x='date', y='co2', data=data, ci=None, hue='year', legend=False, palette='viridis')
sns.lineplot(x='date', y='co2', data=data, ci=None, hue='month', legend=False, palette='viridis')
ax.set(xlabel='Year', ylabel='CO2 Concentration (ppm)')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.title('What is the seasonal variation in CO2 concentration?')
plt.legend(title='Year', loc='upper left', bbox_to_anchor=(1, 1))
plt.show()
